comment: Prof J is a nice guy. He is a student himself and it's very clear he's too busy with his own studies to care about ours. He cancelled 12/30 classes. This makes it hard to keep up. He is very inconsistent with grading. Everything is curved but still not an easy A. Class will not prepare you for Research Methods (if you need that course next).
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY

comment: Professor Jendzurski is a pretty awesome and chill guy. He's a student himself so he's pretty cool about deadlines and gives wonderful feedback. I was completely terrified about public speaking but he makes it fun and interesting. Would take him again if I had the chance!

Professor J isn't your typical professor because he's actually a student at Life as well. This makes him very understanding. However, this also makes him very low-key and he often cancels class. You need to attend his lectures when he actually holds class sessions, or you won't pass the 3 tests. But, his lectures are very engaging; I learned a lot.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: Honestly,  I took this class because I saw the reviews on here. He was highly unprofessional. He cancelled class all the time, tested us on Material he didn't even teach, and assigned us a paper that we couldn't write because we knew nothing about it. He does curve his tests (everyone fails). But don't take him if you like consistency

Took him for public speaking and would definitly recomend you do the same! He is extremely nice & funny. He is young, energetic and lectures are fun and easy to pay attention to. He is very clear with what he wants from you. Dont need textbook but workbook is needed. Put some effort into improving your speeches and you walk out with an easy A
Amazing teacher, he is a student himself so he understand the students. Recommend and would take again. Not many  teachers I would write a review about but he deserves one and is a great teacher.
rating_tags: CARES ABOUT STUDENTS--Respected by students--Amazing lectures

comment: Professor J is an all around good dude. He cares about the material and about the students. He's in school himself so he's really lenient with homework deadlines because he knows how it feels to be a student. Overall a ridiculously easy class. 4 tests, one project. Just study his reading guides and you'll do well on all of the tests.  Take him.

Professor Jendzurski is probably the best professor I have had. Extremely funny and makes his lectures extremely entertaining. Tests are somewhat challenging but if you go to class he tells you what will be on them and extra credit answers are given. Go to class and A is easily manageable. One presentation which is an easy A.

Professor Jendzurski is a really nice guy. I'm sure he's a better teacher in subjects with real content. This was bascially a 'How To Write A Paper 101' type class. Very boring.  He's really into his students though. Don't hesitate to ask for help. He'll help you out, even if it's regarding another class.

Cool guy.  Got a B in the class.  There was one group presentation.  Extra credit project that you can do over the break.  Tests were ok, don't write in your textbook and you can resell it.  Would reccommend this professor.  He didn't take attendance but I went to all the classes.  4 tests including the final exam.

Professor J is such an amazing teacher. He makes the class entertaining and is extremely good with giving you grades back fast. He is funny and uses examples that everyone can understand. Really enjoyed this class!

Professor Jendzurski is such a cool professor. He makes the class really interesting and values class participation. If he ever ask for volunteers raise your hand immediately because you will most likely get extra credit. You only have 4 test the 4th one being the final (equally weighted) (not cumulative). 1 group speech (very easy).

I took professor J at 8 am and he actually made it enjoyable! He's very passionate when it comes to teaching and he is helpful with students . He's also very witty and entertaining. Class attendance is optional, but recommended.  I would definitely take him again.

Absolutely loved Professor J.  Very helpful and his lectures are always great. Gives opportunities for extra credit. Easy A. Just come to lecture and take notes the test are literally what he goes over. One group project and he helps you with it step by step. Definitely recommend him and would take again for any class.

Professor J is a really cool guy that actively tries to engage his students. I feel like the tests are pretty difficult for an intro level freshman course though. As a junior communications major, I barely pulled a B in the class and I studied for every test. He knows his stuff though, and I would take him again.

Professor J is very interesting in all of his lectures and really engages the students. There are 4 tests, one project and about 3 homework assignments. Make sure you read the book and come to class because all of that information will be on the test. He made me change my major to communications, overall amazing class and I would take again.

I hate 8ams BUT Prof. J made it worth it! He's very interactive & engaging when it comes to his teaching. Do NOT be afraid to ask questions & admit you need help. He is in school as well, so he understands the needs of his students.  Few tests, assignments are easy-going and enjoyable! You'll learn a lot. He's amazing and well respected. Take him!

Professor J is great. You can tell that he himself is still attending school and he sets very realistic goals for his class. He accepts late work, replies to emails quickly, and really takes the time to help students out. He wants everyone to succeed and he makes communications interesting. I wish all of my professors were just like him.

Professor J. is probably the best professor I've ever had. He's very easy to talk to and is always willing to help. If you don't do well in this class, it's because you didn't put in the effort. He gives great feedback and will work with you if you ask for his advice. Hoping he teaches some other classes that I can take.

Make sure you read the chapters or at least look over them. His tests include material from his lectures and the book. So make sure you GO TO CLASS! He gives out random attendance assignments, so if you're not there you'l get a 0 for that week. He is fresh out of grad school so it's really easy to talk to him. He relates to his students. Take him.

Mr. J is very passionate about what he does. Sometimes his lectures are a bit long, but he does his absolute best to keep everyone engaged. There's not a lot of homework or quizzes, just a few big tests, so be prepared!
